quoteFirst: Finally, having considered a number of alternative routes, I selected a slow train, which was to leave the Zoölogical Garden Station, where our luggage was, at
quoteLast: for Hanover, and was due to arrive some time after 6 P.M. I went to sleep, dead tired, at about 2:45.
title: My Escape from Germany
author: Keith, Eric A.

quoteFirst: From Kamaiwâwong to the forest fringe was a hard three hours’ walk, with no halt save an occasional pause for breath. At
quoteLast: we reached the highest point of the savannah hills, 6,510 feet above sea-level. Then we dropped down some fifty feet to the edge of the forest, and made our first halt, from 10.35 a.m. to 12.17 p.m., in thick jungle by the side of a delightful gurgling brook, which dashes down icy cold from Roraima’s bleak heights.
title: Through British Guiana to the summit of Roraima
author: Clementi, Cecil, Mrs.

quoteFirst: , Washington time (or, according to the “new reckoning,” eight minutes and twelve seconds later in each case). The moon approaches nearest to the earth on the 12th, at
quoteLast: , and is farthest away on the 24th, at 10:12 a. m. Its greatest altitude in this latitude will be on the morning of the 14th, when it will be 60° 53′ above the southern point of our horizon.
title: The Chautauquan, Vol. 04, December 1883
author: Chautauqua Literary and Scientific Circle; Chautauqua Institution; Flood, Theodore L., 1842- [Editor]
